task.title: Task: Creating a List Box
task.shortdesc: How to create a list box in a field so that the values ​be selected from a list.

taskbody.context: When only a limited number of pre-defined values ​​should be entered in a field, then the use of a list box can be very useful. For example, the Customers table has a field Region in which only the values ​​North and South are allowed. In the following steps the data type for this field will be changed in a list box. Unfortunately, the list box does not automatically update the forms that are based on this table as the form Registration. To make the list box work in the form Registration, you must in design view first remove the field Region and then added again. That's not part of this task.

step.cmd: Open table Customers in Design View.
Click in the box Data Type of field Region.
Click the down arrow and select Lookup Wizard....
step.stepresult: The first dialog box of the Lookup Wizard appears.

step.cmd: Select the option I will type in the values that I want. and click Next.
step.stepresult: Now you can type in the values for the list.

step.cmd: Type in the first cellNorth and in the second cell South.
Switch to Datasheet View and answer the question to save the table with Yes.

steps.stepsection: Checking the operation of the list box.

step.cmd: Click at some customer in the field Region and make sure the list box is present and works.
